John White & co.,
                            
                             New York, 8 Jan 1827
                        
               
                    …much obliged for the clock which came safely…we credit you in account with
                        54F 50 c at the current exchange rate…enclosed letter from Dr John White
                  
                        
                        …first of exchange from Thomas Callendar & co
                        , New York, 31 Jan 1827 in favour of yourself and Welles & Co, Paris at
                        60 days sight for 3185 francs for which at …cents per dollar we have
                        600dollars….. account of directeures receivings by us for you the first of
                        exchange of Thomas Callerson and co at 60 days sight… we are obliged to
                        trouble you in this manner from the efficiency of promising so small a Bill
                        from not being aware of the creditor of Mr Randall  in
                        Paris. Robert White is cashier of the Manhattan Bank
                        and will be glad to transact any business for your monied friends in
                            Paris…le Roy Benger & co. were extensively
                        known there to select a new agent… his being commissioner of loans in this
                        state gives him many advantages in this subject and enables him to attent to
                        the collection of investments of stock in the most prompt manner. 
                    
                        [Enclosure is photographed] – not yet transcribed

Anthony Morris,
                            
                             Washington, 25 Sep 1827
                        
               
                    [Acknowledging favour of 19 June by Mr Clay due to
                        absence from work. Made enquiries of DBW’s behalf] respecting the lands of
                        the son of the late Baron de Hall…they cannot be
                        answered in detail in time to go with the dispatches fr m the Department of
                        State to Paris, which for this month, will close tomorrow; by those of next
                        month I will write you more particularly…I would recommend to your friend
                        not to sell, at this time, the lands in question, they tell me … many
                        inquiries have been made …with views of purchase. 
                     They are situare in the County of Tuscarawas, not far it is said from the
                        County town of New Philadelphia, which is in the vicinity of the popos’d
                        canal from Cleveland on Lake Erie to the Ohio, and rapidly encreasing in
                        value…
                     [Has requested info from Colonel Watson’s office on
                        the tax that would be payable on selling the lands] …
                        You may freely command for him any further services in my power.
                     No reply is usually given by the President of the Us to applications similar
                        to those you mention, but I would recommend a similar one from our American
                        friends who may be in Paris, supported by some of the distinguished members
                        of the Societies there, by whom you are so well known and to be as specific
                        in its object as may be, and address to the Secretary of State – I shall be
                        very happy to be able to give you any assistance here. If you are on good
                        terms with our Minister Mr Brown, his recommendation
                        to Mr Clay would be very imposing…
                    
                        [More untranscribed letters electing people to societies
                            and sending Annals de Chimie to American contacts]
